content.description: Start on the two obvious holds - left hand on a pinch, right on a jug. Left heel hook on the almost definitely wet ledge just inside the cave, right foot stuck up in the crack on what you can find. Go straight up to the ledge and work your way up the knobs, while avoiding dabbing on the boulders on either side of you. Once you get to the top left corner of the ledge feature (the start of Suspended Believe), pull onto the overhanging face using a good side pull and a knob, and then go straight up to the lip and top out from there. You do not have to traverse the lip or climb the overhanging face to the peak.
content.protection: However many pads you can fit down there. At least one to protect the start and one further back to protect a fall from further up. I experimented with hanging pads with a strap against the two boulders on either side as well, though ultimately my strategy was to bail rather than try anything risky...
content.location: Hard to miss this one. Start is at the entrance to the little cave, 20 feet or so from the stream.

content.description: Start on the good protruding holds on the top left corner of the ledge. Get your feet up, go to a good right side pull up and a knob, and then go straight up to the lip and top outÂ from there. You do not have to traverse the lip or climb the overhanging face to the peak.
content.protection: PG-13 FOR SURE (MP is glitching and doesn't show the safety rating). As many pads as you can fit down there/hang from the sides?
content.location: Hard to miss this one. Start is above the entrance to the little cave, 20 feet or so from the stream, a few moves into Suspended Disbelieve.

content.description: Start on the great undercling rail. Go up and left to a left-hand gaston, then traverse left on very smooth, shallow slopers, until you get your feet established on the slab just to the right of Suspended Disbelieve. Top out from there.
content.protection: You're low almost the whole way, but the rock is very smooth, so you could get away with no pads, or you might want a few in case a hand or foot slips.
content.location: Located on the boulder just to the right of Suspended Disbelieve. The start is about 10 feet toward the water from the entrance to the little cave.

content.description: Same as The Smoothness, but the left-hand gaston is OFF. Traverse left on very smooth, shallow slopers, until you get your feet established on the slab just to the right of Suspended Disbelieve. Top out from there.
content.protection: You're low almost the whole way, but the rock is very smooth, so you could get away with no pads, or you might want a few in case a hand or foot slips.
content.location: Located on the boulder just to the right of Suspended Disbelieve. The start is about 10 feet toward the water from the entrance to the little cave.

content.description: Same as Don't Get Your Feet Wet, but the wide ledge in on.
content.location: To the left of Suspended Disbelieve.

content.description: Seriously - smooth, algae-coated rock at the start. Work your way up and right on good holds to top out at the tallest point. Giant edge about halfway up is off. Or use it if that feels safer and more fun, just makes it a little easier.
content.location: Looking toward Suspended Disbelief, it's on your left, just before the water. Obvious lines of cracks and edges.

content.description: Hard to miss from the water - a tall, pyramid-shaped boulder suspended in between two other boulders. Small cave underneath.
